reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is a totally redon palace from the 14th century that is totally in line with modern life. We were in a large, very pleasant room on the third floor. Luckily the staff carried our too heavy bags both ways.
reviews.title: Great Historic Property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011
reviews.text: The desk was very knowledgable and helpful on where to find a place to eat dinner on the town's virtually closed Monday evening.
reviews.title: Good, small hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A wonderful breakfast in a charming sunlit breakfast room concluded our stay.
reviews.title: The BEST POSSIBLE EXPERIENCE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay. Good room tho had to keep the window closed at night as we faced the airport. Service was very good both at reception and by waiters. Always had parking available outside the hotel.
reviews.title: has the WOW factor!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: On route from Ireland to the South of Spain, and have done this trip many times and stayed in many hotels, but Hotel Obispo tops them all. It is the most friendly hotel I have ever come across, the decor is gorgeous, in the old character yet fully modern where needed. Hondarribia is so beautiful, and the people are so friendly. Highly recommend the place, and most particularly Hotel Obispo.
reviews.title: Good hotel near to everthing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I just spend two nights at the Obisop hotel in Hondarribia. It was a great stay. The hotel sits on a square atop a small hill just adjacent to the town. The church bells chime until 10 PM then start up at 8 AM. The building dates to the 1500's and was the residence of the bishop. Our room was modern and large enough. The beds were comfy and the wi-fi worked great. The noise of the bar/restaurant below us subsided at 10 PM and led to a comfortable sleep. We have no complaints and would stay here again if in the area. We thoroughly enjoyed walking into Hondarribia for tapas and drinks each evening. Staying here was a fun part of our journey through Spain.
reviews.title: Terrific Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Obispo late Aug in the lovely little Basque town of Hondarribia. The Obispo is situated in the old part of town, surrounded by typical Basque style houses, narrow cobbled streets and lovely plazas, where a few low key cafes/bars/restaurants offer a well deserved relax. The old town's church forms an impressive focus on the Hondarribian skyline. It is situated next to the 5* Parador.
reviews.title: Hondarribia? You must stay here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012
reviews.text: Down the hill a 5 min walk takes you into the town itself- 3 main streets which are not long, with a few shops and lots of Pinxtos bars. The presentation of these snacks (both hot and cold) is tremendous, washed down with a glass of txakoli ( a light white wine poured from a height to get some fizz in!). There is a great vibe here and the buzz lasts all evening with an eclectic mix of people.
reviews.title: Good value in an excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hondarribia has a sizeable beach with another bigger one in Hendaye (France), reachable over the river Bidesoa by a 7 min ferry. Hondarribia is surrounded by the Pyrenees and overlooked by the impressive Mt Jaizkibel. Catching the bus to San Sebastian is easy. Take the E21 with 'AP' sign ( Autopista) displayed on the window. The bus stop is a mere trundle down the steps from the Obispo.
reviews.title: nice location in the old part of town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Obispo is tremendous. The staff are very curteous and helpful. The rooms are spacious and breakfast is served on a delightful terrace/ courtyard. A great way to start your day! After an evening trawling the Pinxtos bars it was lovely to come back to the Obispo and relax with one of Victor's famous Mohitos, made from fresh mint of course! A Ms Olazabal deserved a special mention on the reception desk, so friendly and offered great advice. Overall a great time and would definately stay here again if ever in the region.
reviews.title: A gem!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012
reviews.text: Hondarabbia is a historical little town at the atlantic, next to french border.
reviews.title: Friendly Medieval hostal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is situated on a higher part, giving glimpses of the port.
reviews.title: charming!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice indoor terrace and friendly service in a historical building. Comfortable and clean rooms.
reviews.title: AMAZING!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This (15th century fort) is a lovely place to stay in Hondaribbia and excellently located for walking to just about everywhere. We dined at the Sebastian restaurant and the fabulous Michelin starred Alameda - both less than 5 minutes away and a short wander downtown on the third night was no hardship. The bus stop for a twenty minute ride into San Sebastian is just beneath the hotel and the old town has to be one of the prettiest in Spain. Champagne cocktails in the Parador bar next door set us up nicely before dinner each night. A truly delightful and restful place for three days. Lovely, courteous staff at the Obispo and parking out the front . Perfect.
reviews.title: Charming hotel in a beautiful location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and my girlfriend had a little break which included visiting Biarritz, San Sebastian and Hondarribia. We normally stay in independant apartments but glad we chose the Obispo. Little tricky findintg the place if you make a wrong turn but by asking one of the locals they will point you in the right direction. The hotel is like a medieval fort but modernized slightly. as other reviews have pointed out the staff spoke good english and were very helpful.
reviews.title: Convenient to Basque Country and Good Food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This was part of a birthday destination week in Spain and my friend took care of booking all the hotels. This was a treat. The hotel is charming and it was a great stay. The room was updated and cozy. My friends had an amazing room with a balcony so I hung out there :-) As this is a historic building pack lightly as you may have to drag your luggage up many stairs.
reviews.title: A Great Night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had two rooms on the second floor of the Hotel Obispo for two nights in June. Everything good that anyone has said about this hotel is true -- including that it's a tad difficult to reach by car; you have to pull into what looks like a closed road and then talk through the speaker and someone opens the way -- sort of like lowering the drawbridge:)
reviews.title: Lovely just as predicted

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having taken a look inside the parador, I think the Obispo is much more charming and warmer.
reviews.title: has as Parador feel to it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My adult children and their 1 year old had a room with a balcony and big arched windows looking toward the bay. My room looked down on the small square on the other side of the hotel. Both were clean, beautifully and simply furnished, with modern bathrooms.
reviews.title: Lovely building, period decoration, great location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Too drizzly for us to eat outside but we enjoyed the large windows in the breakfast area and the wide selection.
reviews.title: Superbe!
